main event: On May 29, 1958, a civilian employee of the United States Air Force observed an unidentified flying object hovering at an altitude of 1,000 to 1,500 feet in Trenton, N.J.
interesting points: The object was circular and approximately 20-30 feet in diameter, emitting a yellowish-white glow., The object remained stationary for several minutes before accelerating rapidly and disappearing., A photograph taken later showed a small white speck on the moon, which was suggested to be caused by photographic emulsion., The sighting lasted for about 5 minutes, with very clear weather conditions., The investigation involved multiple reviews and expert opinions regarding the photograph's significance.
witness description: a civilian employee of the United States Air Force
